trans-unit.source: Represents a reference to an index of an array.
CodeArrayIndexerExpression can be used to represent a reference to an index of an array of one or more dimensions.
Use <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeIndexerExpression> for representing a reference to an index of a code (non-array) indexer.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeArrayIndexerExpression.TargetObject%2A> property indicates the indexer object.

The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeArrayIndexerExpression.Indices%2A> property indicates either a single index within the target array, or a set of indexes that together specify a specific intersection of indexes across the dimensions of the array.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeArrayIndexerExpression"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeArrayIndexerExpression"></xref> class using the specified target object and indexes.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> that indicates the array the indexer targets.
The index or indexes to reference.
Gets or sets the index or indexes of the indexer expression.

This <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeExpressionCollection> can contain a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeExpression> that specifies a single index within the target array, or multiple <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeExpression> objects that together specify a specific intersection of indexes across the dimensions of the array.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpressionCollection"></xref> that indicates the index or indexes of the indexer expression.
Gets or sets the target object of the array indexer.

This property typically contains either a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeVariableReferenceExpression>, a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodePropertyReferenceExpression>, or a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeFieldReferenceExpression>.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> that represents the array being indexed.
